intro: Erodium munbyanum, commonly known as the Munby's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pinkish to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has slender stems and trifoliate leaves, which are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
